title: The Million Dollar Tennis Point Game
summary: In tennis, there is a fun event called the Million Dollar One Point Slam. It happens in Australia before the Australian Open. Amateur players, who are not professionals, can win a big prize of one million Australian dollars. They play against top tennis stars like Carlos Alcaraz and Iga Swiatek. The game is simple: each match is just one point! Players decide who serves by playing rock, paper, scissors. There are 48 players total, including 24 pros and 24 amateurs from state championships or wildcards like celebrities. The final is at Rod Laver Arena. This event lets regular people compete with the best and have a chance to win money.

background_read: Tennis is a sport where players hit a ball over a net. The Australian Open is a big tennis tournament in Australia. Amateurs are people who play for fun, while professionals play for money. Rock, paper, scissors is a simple game where players show hand signs to decide things. This event mixes fun and competition by letting amateurs play with pros in a quick one-point game.
Article_Structure: WHO: Amateur and professional tennis players, including stars like Carlos Alcaraz and Iga Swiatek, and celebrities like Jay Chou.
WHAT: A tennis event where players compete in one-point matches to win one million Australian dollars.
WHERE: At Melbourne Park in Australia, with the final at Rod Laver Arena.
WHY: To give amateur players a chance to compete with top professionals and win prize money in a fun, fast-paced game.
